uno

Class GameTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • uno.GameTest

  • public class GameTest
extends java.lang.Object
    JUnit tests for the game logic.
    Author:
    Derek Syrba, John Frocillo, Adrian Harrel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameTest()

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameTest

        public GameTest()

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
        Instantiate a new UnoGame before every test.

      • testPlayCard

        public void testPlayCard()
        Test the playCard method of the game. When a player plays a card, the game must check if it is a valid move, once that is checked, the game will play the card from their hand.

      • testDrawCard

        public void testDrawCard()
        Test the drawCard method of the game. When a player draws a card their hand/deck size should increase by 1 (or however many is passed as a parameter)

      • testChangeTurn

        public void testChangeTurn()
        Test the changeTurn method of the game. If the game has not been reversed, the flow should be player 1,2,3,4. If the order is reversed, the flow should be player 4,3,2,1.

      • testNextPlayer

        public void testNextPlayer()
        Tests the nextPlayer method of the game. This method keeps track of the flow of the game. Normally, the next player is the one counter clockwise to the current player. If the order of play has been reversed, then the "next player" should be the player sitting clockwise to the player whose turn it is.

      • testCurrentPlayer

        public void testCurrentPlayer()
        Tests the currentPlayer method of the game. The method should correctly return whose turn it currently is when called.

      • testIsGameOver

        public void testIsGameOver()
        Tests the IsGameOver method of the game. If any player's hand is now empty (0 cards), then they have won the game.

      • testNextCard

        public void testNextCard()
        Tests the method that sets the next card variable for game flow. If the current card is different after the method is called, then it has successfully moved the current card to the new one that is being viewed.

      • testReshuffle

        public void testReshuffle()
        Tests the reshuffle method of the game. The draw pile deck order should be different after a reshuffle.

      • testDeal

        public void testDeal()
        Tests the dealing method of the game. Players should have 7 cards each.
